thread.title: Police search for driver after Nashua collision
thread.title_full: Police search for driver after Nashua collision

title: Police search for driver after Nashua collision
text:
Thursday, October 8, 2015 Police search for driver after Nashua collision 
New Hampshire State Police are searching for the driver of a black SUV who fled the scene of a three-vehicle collision on Brooke Village Road in south Nashua Wednesday just before 5:30 p.m.The 2003 black Mercury SUV was described by troopers as driving erratically southbound on the Everett Turnpike near Exit 1 in Nashua, the evening of Wednesday, Oct. 7. Troopers Brian Viglione and Ryan Hickey were monitoring traffic when they noticed the SUV and followed it off the highway. Shortly after exiting the highway, the SUV was involved in a collision with two other cars; a 2001 blue Chrysler Town and Country and a 2013 blue Ford Flex. Witnesses at the scene told troopers the operator of the black SUC caused the collision and fled. Nashua police helped state troopers and a State Police K-9 unit search for the suspect. Because the area is densely populated and has heavy foot traffic, the K-9 unit was unsuccessful in tracking the suspect, according to state police. The three vehicles involved in the collision were towed. Nashua Fire Rescue and emergency responders treated injuries on scene, and the occupants of the other two vehicles reported minor injuries.Anyone with information is asked to call Trooper Hickey at 223-4381. The driver of the black Mercury SUV was described as a white male, stocky build and wearing a blue jacket, last seen on Spit Brook Road. - Telegraph Staff Please sign up for as low as 36 cents per day to continue viewing our website.
